title: Full-stack JavaScript developer
description:
- Technologies: React, NextJS, Jest, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Redux, Fastify, NodeJS, DevOps (AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, GHA)
- eCommerce platform
- Focus on UX, user engagement and performance 
 - Migrate to new react versions
details:
Led the front-end development of a high-performance e-commerce platform, focusing on user engagement and developer productivity.

  • Delivered critical features following extensive marketing campaigns by the business under a tight deadline and uncertain requirements. I was the lead front-end developer for this feature, implementing complex mapping features with the possibility to list, filter, and sort deals based on a selected location (by default using the current user location). We successfully delivered the "going local" feature as a team, boosting conversion rates by 20%.
  • Re-architected and redesigned the React/Next.js-based frontend, migrating to new versions in the process, resulting in a 25% increase in user engagement, a 20% boost in conversion rates, and a 10% decrease in customer support contact ratio.
  • Optimized site performance with server-side rendering and redux state management, reducing average page load time from 3.5s to 1.6s, leading to a 15% decrease in bounce rate.
  • Established coding standards and introduced Jest unit testing with Sonar and Github actions to automate and provide measurable code quality metrics, increasing team productivity by 30%, reducing time-to-market for new features by 25%, and enhancing code quality by 40% through test coverage.
  • Optimize resource utilization of the front-end application on production servers
    • Use Helm charts and Kubernetes to manage the front-end app
    • Decrease server resource usage by reducing pod count by 50%, thus reducing front-end server cost by almost 40% for the business
    • Implement image delivery caching:
      • Separate NextJs image caching from deployment
      • Rebuild cache only for new images
    • Results:
      • 60%+ reduction in deployment time
      • Seamless user experience (image cache persists across deployments, except when rebuilt)
  • Negotiating with business stakeholders and product owners to architecture and develop an API gateway to facilitate collaboration between multiple teams in the organization, and led the migration of front-end APIs to use the new standardized REST API gateway, resulting in faster development for the app development team and the adoption of proper API documentation for the backend of the project.

Technologies: React, Next.js, TypeScript, Node.js, Fastify, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes
